page.title: 01 Meall Bhanabhie: Overview
page.content:
The area being surveyed here consists wholly the southerly slopes of the hill,{Meall Bhanabhie}known locally as Banavie hill or, at the westerly extent of the survey area - Corpach hill.
More than half the hillside is of open heather and coarse grass slopes, seldom grazed by domestic animals and as rarely visited by the human animal. Somewhat less than half the hillside has been developed as forestry and is planted with coniferous woodland. Along the southern edge of the survey area there is some housing, and further areas of interest are provided by Banavie Quarry and the Caledonian Canal, both of which are to be found in the south-east most part of the survey area.
